MissionCommands.Message: Welcome to the Mission Control Live version of the Mercury-Redstone 4 historical mission. The cockpit is ready for full internal power and final checks.

Title: MR-4: Liberty Bell 7
Description:
The Mercury-Redstone 4 (Liberty Bell 7) mission is the second U.S. space flight with the goals of testing additional attitude control modes, mans ability to operate in space and verify spacecraft systems.

Astronaut: Gus Grissom
BriefingText:
Mercury-Redstone 4: "Liberty Bell 7"

Mission Objectives:
1. Familiarize man with a brief but complete space flight experience, including the lift-off, powered flight, weightless flight (approximately 5 minutes), re-entry, and landing phases of the flight.
2. Evaluate man's ability to perform as a functional unit during space flight by demonstrating manual control of spacecraft attitude before, during, and after retrofire and by use of voice communications during flight.
3. Study man's physiological reactions during space flight.
4. Qualify the explosively-actuated side egress hatch.

Flight Plan:
00:00 - Lift-off
00:30 - Systems report
01:00 - Systems report
01:15 - Cabin pressure report
01:30 - Systems report
02:00 - Systems report
02:23 - Launch-vehicle engine cutoff & tower sep, retro jettison switch OFF
02:33 - Spacecraft seperation from launch vehicle
02:38 - Spacecraft turnaround to flight attitude on autopilot
03:00 - Transfer of flight control from autopilot to manual proportional control system, and evaluation of system.
04:00 - Spacecraft yawed 45 degrees to left using horixon as attitude reference
05:10 - Retrograde rockets fired manually
05:35 - Retrojettison system armed, transfer of flight control from manual proportinal control system to rate command control system, radio transmitter switched from UHF to HF
06:10 - Retropackage jettison
06:40 - Periscope retracts automatically (can be later in Reentry), spacecraft positioned into reentry attitude.
07:00 - Communications switched back to UHF transmitter
07:46 - Reentry starts
09:41 - Drogue parachute deploy, Snorkels open, Emergency rate oxygen flow
10:13 - Main landing parachute deployment
15:37 - Landing

Mission details:
Commander: Virgil I. "Gus" Grissom
Capsule name: Liberty Bell 7
Booster: Redstone
Mission Profile: Sub-orbital

March 7, 1961: Spacecraft delivered to Hangar S at Cape Canaveral Air Force Station, Florida
July 18, 1961: Original launch date
July 19, 1961: Second launch attempt, cancelled at T-10 minutes due to unfavorable weather
Planned launch time: July 21st 1961 07:20 AM EST
Countdown Start: July 20th 1961 6:00 AM EST PM EST
Capsule Ingress: July 21st 1961 08:58 UTC
Launch: July 21st 1961 at 12:20:36 UTC, after a short hold due to an issue with one of the 70 hatch bolts.

Mission start: 
T -15 minutes with final checks

Notes:
Reentry has desgined a generic capsule with all of the main Mercury features. Some readouts such as voltages, amps, trajectory details etc, might differ from audio. I have tried to recreate the mission to the best of my abilities within the limitation of my sim.

Have a good flight!
